alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 11 at 3:31PM EST until November 11 at 4:15PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTH CENTRAL CHESTERFIELD AND CENTRAL HENRICO COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 331 PM EST, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area earlier. Some residual ponding of water on roadways continues across the city, but the heavy rain has now ended. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, University Of Richmond, Bon Air, Highland Springs, Tuckahoe, Mechanicsville, Bensley, Lakeside, East Highland Park, Laurel, Bellwood, Glen Allen, Montrose, Richmond Heights, Greendale, Dumbarton and Drewrys Bluff. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
